item.title: Gopalganj fisherfolk battling to survive
item.description: The traditional fishermen community in Gopalganj district is in a tight spot for various challenges, especially waning sources of fish and lack of conservation and trade facilities. Around 22,000 members of the fishermen community covering five upazilas of the district have been living amid financ

item.title: BPL returns on Friday after day of uncertainty
item.description: After a day of uncertainty and tension, Bangladesh cricket received a late-night sigh of relief: the Bangladesh Premier League is set to resume. BPL Governing Council Secretary Iftekhar Rahman announced at a press briefing that matches will restart on Friday. He was joined by Cricketers’ We

item.title: Mother-daughter found slain in coaching centre
item.description: Police recovered the bodies of a mother and her daughter from a room in a coaching centre at Muslimbagh, Keraniganj, on Thursday. The deceased were identified as Rokeya Negem, 32, and her 14-year-old daughter Fatema, an eighth-grade student, reports UNB. Keraniganj Model Police Station Officer-in

item.title: Holy Shab-e-Meraj today
item.description: The holy Shab-e-Meraj will be observed across the country tonight with due respect and religious fervour. The Muslims every year on the 26th night of the Arabic month of Rajab observe the Shab-e-Meraj. On this night, Prophet Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) had embarked on a special journey to meet the Almi

item.title: Dhaka, Kathmandu set 3-month deadline to finalise PTA
item.description: Bangladesh and Nepal have agreed to finalise the draft text, rules of origin and product lists of the proposed preferential trade agreement (PTA) within the next three months, aiming to inject fresh momentum into bilateral trade, according to a press statement. The decision was taken at the 8th

item.title: IMF's growth forecasts to show resilience to global trade shocks
item.description: The International Monetary Fund's latest economic forecasts due next week ​will show the global economy's continued resilience to trade shocks and "fairly strong" growth, IMF Managing Director ‌Kristalina Georgieva told Reuters on Thursday. item.title: Fresh election schedule declared for Pabna-1, Pabna-2
item.description: The Election Commission on Thursday announced a fresh election schedule for Pabna-1 and Pabna-2 constituencies to hold polls on February 12 next in line with the order of the Appellate Division. The election schedule was declared, cancelling the previous schedule announced on December 11 last as p

item.title: BNP flags election flaws, urges fairness
item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has voiced concerns over several irregularities, including exploitation of religious sentiment, voter manipulation, and controversies over ballot papers at home and abroad ahead of the country's 13th National Parliament Election. Speaking at a press briefing

item.title: Three die in Uttara fire
item.description: Three people have reportedly died in a fire that broke out in a residential building in Dhaka’s Uttara. The fire erupted early on Friday morning on the second floor of the seven-storey building in Sector No. 11. Two firefighting units rushed to the scene within eight minutes after the incid

item.title: Dhaka’s air at risk as Savar brick kilns defy closure orders
item.description: Despite the government's declaration of Savar upazila as a 'degraded airshed', brick kilns in the area continue operating openly, raising serious concerns over air pollution in Dhaka. The move, intended to protect the capital's northern entry points, appears to have little effect on kiln owners, w

item.title: UK has stressed human rights to Bangladesh’s interim govt: Commons leader
item.description: The UK is actively engaging with the humanitarian situation in Bangladesh and has stressed its long-standing commitment to human rights to the interim government of the country, says Alan Campbell, leader of the House of Commons. He made the remarks in response to a question from Bob Blackman, the

item.title: South Korea court sentences ex-president Yoon to 5 years in prison for obstruction
item.description: A South Korean court on Friday sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for charges including obstructing attempts to arrest him following his failed bid to impose martial law.
